body_html:
@apaszke fair and good questions.

We originally talked about having separate installs for eager, hybrid, and graph, but this doesn't really make sense in the real world. Hybrid is really just the decorators you use to get from eager to graph mode. For including graph mode, the disadvantage is really binary size and dependencies. We decided that binary size was a reasonable tradeoff for a single "batteries included" install and our biggest dependency (protobuf) is now internally built and therefore removed.

Given that, there was general agreement that we should have a single install minus _cuda, _amd, etc. variants and some dependencies like LMDB and LevelDB, which we don't want in the core install.

I'll add you to an internal document we have discussing this, but likely we should create an external one as well.
